sentences.en: ...Connecticut Ave., one of the main arteries of Washington.
sentences.cn: …康涅狄格大道，华盛顿的主干道之一。

sentences.en: ...patients suffering from blocked arteries.
sentences.cn: …患动脉堵塞的病人们。

sentences.en: A muscular spasm in the coronary artery can cause a heart attack.
sentences.cn: 冠状动脉的肌肉痉挛可能导致心脏病。

sentences.en: As the disease progresses, blood clots may develop and plug up the artery, blocking circulation completely.
sentences.cn: 病情发展就会形成血块,将动脉堵住, 使循环完全断绝.

sentences.en: Besides this the Mediterranean was the main artery in the communications of the British Empire.
sentences.cn: 此外,地中海也是英帝国交通运输的主要航道.

sentences.en: Blood enters the kidneys via the renal artery.
sentences.cn: 血液通过肾动脉流进肾脏。

sentences.en: Blood poured from the main artery of the thigh.
sentences.cn: 血从大腿的主动脉涌出.

sentences.en: Blood was spouting from the severed artery.
sentences.cn: 血从切断的动脉里喷出来.

sentences.en: He almost bled to death after the bullet severed an artery.
sentences.cn: 子弹穿过动脉，他失血过多几乎性命不保。

sentences.en: Of, like, or in an artery or arteries.
sentences.cn: 动脉的动脉的，似动脉的，或在动脉里的。

sentences.en: The artery ramified into a network of veins .
sentences.cn: 动脉分枝成许多网状的静脉。

sentences.en: The artery ramifies into a network of veins.
sentences.cn: 动脉分枝成许多网状的静脉.

sentences.en: The caliber of the vein and the artery to which it was anastomosed was similar.
sentences.cn: 用同等口径的动静脉吻合.

sentences.en: The chief artery to the upper limb is the subclavian artery.
sentences.cn: 锁骨下动脉是到上肢的主要动脉.

sentences.en: The research institute is on the track of what causes the artery damage.
sentences.cn: 研究所正在探究动脉损伤的诱因。

sentences.en: The splenic artery supplies the area of the fundus by way of the short gastric arteries.
sentences.cn: 脾幼脉通过胃短幼脉供应胃底部.

sentences.en: The thickened artery wall narrows the channel through which the blood flows.
sentences.cn: 变厚的动脉壁使流通血液的管腔变细.

sentences.en: This term is used to describe a condition in which the blood supply to part of the brain is suddenly and critically impaired by a blood clot or when a ruptured artery leaks blood into the brain.
sentences.cn: 该术语是用来形容如下的一种情况：提供给大脑部分的血液突然地削弱，这种削弱是由于血液的凝固或由于动脉割裂导致血液漏到大脑里面。

sentences.en: We couldn't feel the changes in the blood pressure within the artery.
sentences.cn: 我们无法感觉到动脉血管内血压的变化.

sentences.en: When they are found, doctors pass a tube with a balloon into the narrowed area and inflate the balloon to compress plaque deposits against the side of the artery.
sentences.cn: 当它们被发现后，医生通过一个软管把一个小气球进入狭小的区域并且膨胀这个气球去压缩动脉边沉淀下来的血小板。

words.tran_cn: [解剖] 动脉的；干线的；像动脉的
动脉波；动脉脉搏图；动脉搏描记图
动脉 X 线摄影法

phrases.tran_cn: 冠状动脉旁路；冠状动脉绕道手术；冠状动脉分流术

trans.tran_en: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body
